Discovery of an Opioid K Receptor Selective Pure Antagonist from a Library of
N-Substituted 4-Methyl-5-(3-hydroxyphenyl)morphans

front.div:
A library of compounds biased toward opioid receptor antagonist activity was prepared by
incorporating N-phenylpropyl-4-methyl-5-(3-hydroxyphenyl)morphans as the core scaffold
using simultaneous solution phase synthetic methodology. From this library, N-phenylpropyl-
4-methyl-5-(3-hydroxyphenyl)-7R-[3-(1-piperidinyl)propanamido]morphan [(-)-3b] was identi-
fied as the first potent and selective Îº opioid receptor antagonist from the 5-phenylmorphan
class of opioids.
